function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of discussion on types of disruptions and strategies to solve them may lead to ineffective decision-making and policy formulation.","Impact":"Ineffective decision-making and policy formulation can lead to increased susceptibility to contagious diseases within the supply chain.","Mitigation":"Provide supplemental resources or references for readers to explore types of disruptions and strategies to address them.","Technologies":"Online databases, virtual libraries, and resource repositories for supply chain management and risk mitigation strategies.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, supply chain managers, public health officials.","Owner":"Authors, publishers, professional organizations."},{"Description":"Failure to adequately assess the impact of supply chain disruption on performance may result in unpreparedness for contagious disease outbreaks.","Impact":"Unpreparedness can lead to the rapid spread of contagious diseases within the supply chain and surrounding communities.","Mitigation":"Encourage the use of both qualitative and quantitative methodologies for a comprehensive assessment of disruption impact.","Technologies":"Data analytics, statistical modeling, simulation software.","People":"Supply chain analysts, public health experts, risk management specialists.","Owner":"Research institutions, academic journals, professional associations."},{"Description":"Inadequate consideration of supply chain structure and organization may create vulnerabilities to contagious disease propagation within the network.","Impact":"Vulnerabilities in the supply chain structure can facilitate the spread of contagious diseases and increase the risk of transmission to workers, customers, and the public.","Mitigation":"Incorporate network analysis and modeling tools to assess the resilience of different supply chain structures.","Technologies":"Network analysis software, supply chain modeling platforms, geographic information systems (GIS).","People":"Supply chain architects, logistics managers, public health authorities.","Owner":"Supply chain consulting firms, government agencies, academia."}]}
